p: SARS-CoV-2 represents the third and most-widespread Coronavirus zoonosis, preceded by SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV. All three of these zoonoses are believed to have originated in bats and transitioned to humans via intermediate hosts [ 35]. The Coronavirus' namesake is derived from its structural ‘crown-like’ appearance. The virus is composed of a positive sense single stranded RNA physically associated with a nucleocapsid, within a phospholipid bilayer, with the envelope decorated with externally projecting spike glycoproteins [ 36]. The viral spike interacts with its receptor, the angiotensin converting enzyme receptor-2 (ACE-2r), on susceptible target cells to facilitate entry and viral replication (i.e. viral tropism) [ 37].
